sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The GUI.SetColor procedure is used buttons to change the color of a button. The color is specified by the clrNumber parameter. The edges of the button are a darker version of the color specified by clrNumber, so in general you should use brighter colors for buttons.
sections.mdown_content:
The **GUI.SetColor** procedure is used buttons to change the
color of a button.  The color is specified by the *clrNumber*
parameter.  The edges of the button are a darker version of the 
color specified by *clrNumber*, so in general you should use
brighter colors for buttons.

sections.title: Example
code:
import GUI

        procedure DoNothing
        end DoNothing

        var b1 := GUI.CreateButton (100, 100, 0, "Push Me", DoNothing)
        GUI.SetColor (b1, brightred)
        var b2 := GUI.CreateButton (100, 140, 0, "Push Me", DoNothing)
        GUI.SetColor (b2, brightgreen)
        var b3 := GUI.CreateButton (100, 180, 0, "Push Me", DoNothing)
        GUI.SetColor (b3, brightblue)

        loop
            exit when GUI.ProcessEvent
        end loop
sections.raw_content: This program displays three buttons with different colors.
sections.mdown_content: This program displays three buttons with different colors.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling GUI.SetColor, not by calling SetColor.
